subject: Climate & Environment
title: Flash Floods
description: Learn Flash Floods in one minute.

hook.text: A flash flood can turn a dry creek bed into a raging river in under an hour.

buildup.text: Intense rainfall overwhelms the ground's ability to absorb water. The excess runs off instantly.

discovery.text: Urban areas flood fastest â€” concrete and asphalt prevent any water from soaking in.

twist.text: Just 15 centimeters of fast-moving water can knock an adult off their feet.

climax.text: Half of all flood deaths occur in vehicles. People underestimate the power of moving water.

punchline.text: Water is gentle until it moves. Then nothing stands in its way.

quiz.question: Why do urban areas flood more easily than rural ones?
options: Concrete and asphalt prevent water absorption
Buildings block wind that would dry rain
Cities get more rainfall than rural areas
